request.prompt:
Schreibe mir einen News Artikel mit dem Titel "OpenAI vs. Microsoft: Zerbricht die milliardenschwere KI-Allianz?". 
Der Artikel soll etwa 1 Seite lang sein und mit Markdown formatiert sein. Der Titel soll nicht im Artikel enthalten sein, der Artikel soll direkt mit dem ersten Absatz beginnen. Füge ein <!--more--> zwischen dem ersten und zweiten Absatz ein.
Verwende dabei nur Informationen der letzten 7 Tage, sodass der Artikel nur die aktuellen Neuigkeiten zu dem Thema enthält.
Füge am Ende des Artikels einen Absatz mit den verlinkten Quellen hinzu.

In Brief

Posted:

3:40 PM PDT · June 16, 2025

**Image Credits:**Justin Sullivan / Getty Images

*   [Maxwell Zeff](https://techcrunch.com/author/maxwell-zeff/)

The cracks in the OpenAI-Microsoft relationship are reportedly widening
=======================================================================

OpenAI and Microsoft may be reaching an inflection point in their relationship, according to a [report](https://www.wsj.com/tech/ai/openai-and-microsoft-tensions-are-reaching-a-boiling-point-4981c44f?st=oztNm3&reflink=desktopwebshare_permalink) from The Wall Street Journal.

The report, citing anonymous sources, says OpenAI executives have considered publicly accusing Microsoft of anticompetitive behavior throughout their partnership. OpenAI executives also mulled whether to seek a federal regulatory review of their contract with Microsoft.

OpenAI is trying to loosen Microsoft’s grip on its intellectual property and computing resources, but the startup also needs the tech giant’s approval to complete its for-profit conversion.

The two companies are in a standoff over OpenAI’s $3 billion acquisition of the AI coding startup, Windsurf. OpenAI doesn’t want Microsoft to get Windsurf’s intellectual property — which could enhance the cloud provider’s own AI coding tool, GitHub Copilot — according to the report.

While Microsoft was once a major accelerant to OpenAI’s growth, the companies’ relationship has grown tense. In recent months, OpenAI has reportedly tried to [reduce its reliance on Microsoft for cloud services](https://techcrunch.com/2025/02/21/report-openai-plans-to-shift-com

output.title: Inside Microsoft’s complicated relationship with OpenAI
output.text: Beyond the selfies between Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, and the friendly conversations between the pair on stage, all is not well with Microsoft’s $13 billion AI investment. Over the past year, multiple reports have painted a picture of a Microsoft and OpenAI relationship that is straining under pressure..

output.text: (Reuters) -Microsoft is prepared to walk away from its high-stakes talks with OpenAI over the future of its multibillion-dollar alliance, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday..

OpenAI Weighs Antitrust Complaint vs Microsoft Partner
======================================================

*   Published June 19, 2025
*   ![](https://investors.catenaa.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/Mahasen-300x300.webp)
    
    [Murugaverl Mahasenan](https://investors.catenaa.com/author/maha "Posts by Murugaverl Mahasenan")

*   Share
*   [](https://twitter.com/share?text=OpenAI+Weighs+Antitrust+Complaint+vs+Microsoft+Partner https://investors.catenaa.com/news/openai-considers-antitrust-complaint-against-microsoft-amid-partnership-strain+via+%40Catenaacom)
*   [](http://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https://investors.catenaa.com/news/openai-considers-antitrust-complaint-against-microsoft-amid-partnership-strain)
*   [](http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://investors.catenaa.com/news/openai-considers-antitrust-complaint-against-microsoft-amid-partnership-strain)

![OpenAI Weighs Antitrust Complaint vs Microsoft Partner](https://investors.catenaa.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/OpenAI-Considers-Antitrust-Complaint-Against-Microsoft-Amid-Partnership-Strain-.webp)

> ### In Summary
> 
> *   OpenAI may file an antitrust complaint against Microsoft over cloud and contract leverage
> *   The dispute centers on OpenAI’s restructuring into a public benefit corporation
> *   OpenAI proposes reducing Microsoft’s exclusive hosting and profit rights
> *   Partnership tensions risk disrupting a key AI industry alliance

**Catenaa, Thursday, June 19, 2025-** OpenAI is reportedly weighing a potential antitrust complaint against Microsoft, its largest investor and key partner, The Wall Street Journal reported Monday.

The move marks a sharp escalation in tensions between the two companies that have collaborated closely on artificial intelligence development since 2019.

The proposed complaint would accuse Microsoft of leveraging its dominant cloud services position and contract terms to stifle competition, insiders said, describing the action as a “nuclear option.”

Microsoft invested $1 billion in OpenAI in 2019 and has since injected billions more, gaining exclusive rights to host OpenAI’s AI models on its Azure cloud platform.

At the heart of the dispute is OpenAI’s planned shift from its current nonprofit structure to a Delaware-based public benefit corporation, a change requiring Microsoft’s approval. The two companies have been unable to reach agreement on terms after months of negotiation, Reuters reported.

OpenAI seeks to revise Microsoft’s future equity stake in the restructured entity, reportedly proposing a 33 percent ownership in exchange for Microsoft relinquishing rights to future profits, according to The Information. OpenAI also aims to alter clauses granting Microsoft exclusive hosting rights, potentially opening the door to competitors.

The disagreement threatens to unravel one of the AI sector’s most significant partnerships, potentially reshaping the business and regulatory landscape of artificial intelligence.

From partners to rivals? OpenAI mulls antitrust action against Microsoft
========================================================================

By [Vishnu Kaimal](https://americanbazaaronline.com/author/vishnu-kaimal/ "Posts by Vishnu Kaimal")June 18, 20253 Mins Read

[](https://americanbazaaronline.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Open-Ai-and-MICROSOFT.png "From partners to rivals? OpenAI mulls antitrust action against Microsoft")

Share

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2F2025%2F06%2F18%2Ffrom-partners-to-rivals-openai-mulls-antitrust-action-against-microsoft-463887%2F "Facebook") [Twitter](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2F2025%2F06%2F18%2Ffrom-partners-to-rivals-openai-mulls-antitrust-action-against-microsoft-463887%2F&text=From%20partners%20to%20rivals%3F%20OpenAI%20mulls%20antitrust%20action%20against%20Microsoft "Twitter") [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2F2025%2F06%2F18%2Ffrom-partners-to-rivals-openai-mulls-antitrust-action-against-microsoft-463887%2F "LinkedIn") [Pinterest](https://pinterest.com/pin/create/button/?url=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2F2025%2F06%2F18%2Ffrom-partners-to-rivals-openai-mulls-antitrust-action-against-microsoft-463887%2F&media=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2025%2F06%2FOpen-Ai-and-MICROSOFT.png&description=From%20partners%20to%20rivals%3F%20OpenAI%20mulls%20antitrust%20action%20against%20Microsoft "Pinterest") [Email](mailto:?subject=From%20partners%20to%20rivals%3F%20OpenAI%20mulls%20antitrust%20action%20against%20Microsoft&body=https%3A%2F%2Famericanbazaaronline.com%2F2025%2F06%2F18%2Ffrom-partners-to-rivals-openai-mulls-antitrust-action-against-microsoft-463887%2F "Email")

OpenAI is considering getting the United States government involved in its fight against Microsoft. The Wall Street Journal reported on Monday that OpenAI executives have discussed filing an antitrust complaint with the U.S. regulators against Microsoft, the company’s largest investor, marking a dramatic escalation in tensions between the two long-term AI partners.

The potential antitrust complaint would likely argue that Microsoft is using its dominant position in cloud services and contractual leverage to suppress competition, according to insiders who described it as a “nuclear option,” the WSJ reports.

**[READ: In shareholder letter, Satya Nadella touts Microsoft’s record AI growth, expands future vision](https://americanbazaaronline.com/2024/10/24/satya-nadella-touts-microsofts-record-ai-growth-expands-future-vision-456765/)** (October 24, 2024)

Tensions between [OpenAI and Microsoft](https://americanbazaaronline.com/2025/03/12/microsoft-to-build-ai-models-to-rival-openai-satya-nadella-focused-on-full-stack-integration460621/) have been escalating in 2025, marking a major shift in what was once one of the tech industry’s most prominent partnerships. Central to the conflict is OpenAI’s proposed corporate restructuring to become a public-benefit corporation, a move aimed at allowing greater operational independence and attracting new investors—most notably SoftBank, which is considering a $30 billion investment that would value OpenAI at $300 billion.

As part of this transition, OpenAI is pushing to reduce Microsoft’s ownership stake to 33%, which has sparked concerns in Redmond, given Microsoft’s prior investment of over $13 billion in OpenAI’s development and infrastructure.

In addition to disputes over ownership, the two companies are clashing over intellectual property r

Key Takeaways

*   **Windsurf heats up AI rivalry**: OpenAI’s $3B Windsurf deal threatens GitHub Copilot, especially with its offline features and a $200M Pentagon contract.
*   **IP clash strains partnership:** Microsoft claims rights to Windsurf via its 2019 deal. OpenAI argues acquisitions don’t count, fueling mounting legal and strategic tensions. 
*   **$20B funding at risk:** OpenAI must restructure by year-end to secure SoftBank’s full investment. Miss the deadline, and $20B disappears.

 ![OpenAI and Microsoft: A Partnership on the Rocks Over Windsurf and a $200M Pentagon Deal](https://techreport.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/OpenAI-and-Microsoft-A-Partnership-on-the-Rocks-Over-Windsurf-and-a-200M-Pentagon-Deal-3.png)

By now, it’s no secret that OpenAI and Microsoft are no longer cuddling under a blanket of cloud computing. 

We’ve been seeing signs for months – awkward press releases, strategic misalignments, and let’s be honest, an increasingly apparent competitive tension. 

But the latest report confirms what many in the industry already suspected: the once-dreamy AI partnership is now entering messy-divorce territory. And the smoking gun? A small but powerful acquisition called Windsurf. 

Windsurf Might Just Be Microsoft’s Worst Headache Yet
-----------------------------------------------------

At first glance, [Windsurf](https://windsurf.com/) might seem like just another AI coding startup. But don’t let the breezy name fool you. 

Windsurf isn’t just about writing better code – it’s about writing it smarter, faster, and crucially, offline. 

![Windsurf – write with Cascade](https://lh7-rt.googleusercontent.com/docsz/AD_4nXc1nm6QalLa4hcA13SxkpB4rnVRW2_gkh30W5sIJsyf0P2U5OKxuT34kl2MqaGDGL9OCWr7R9nyBIYzTgrhX9JKoClvaA8ZxJfi9fozkRIJUGqo_xertdhPW8332XACp0Q5JP4g?key=Yq4icw7O16NlpFiOlWYXHA)

_Source: Windsurf_

Unlike Microsoft’s GitHub Copilot, Windsurf can be deployed on local servers or private cloud environments. That makes it a massive deal for anyone who doesn’t want their code flying off to the cloud every time they hit ‘Enter.’ 

Now imagine you’re the Pentagon. You want cutting-edge AI tools, but they must run securely, inside government walls. No outside servers. No data leaks. No compromises. Copilot doesn’t cut it. Windsurf does. 

That’s precisely why OpenAI landed a [$200M contract](https://www.defense.gov/News/Contracts/Contract/Artic

result.content:
Die Spannungen zwischen OpenAI und Microsoft haben in den letzten Tagen einen neuen Höhepunkt erreicht. Berichten zufolge erwägt OpenAI, seinen größten Investor und Partner Microsoft wegen wettbewerbswidrigen Verhaltens zu verklagen. Diese drastische Maßnahme, die als "nukleare Option" bezeichnet wird, könnte die milliardenschwere Allianz zwischen den beiden Technologie-Giganten endgültig zerbrechen lassen【2-0】【2-3】.

<!--more-->

Im Zentrum des Konflikts steht OpenAIs geplante Umstrukturierung in eine gewinnorientierte Firma, die eine Zustimmung von Microsoft erfordert. OpenAI strebt an, Microsofts exklusive Rechte an Hosting und zukünftigen Gewinnen zu reduzieren, was zu erheblichen Spannungen geführt hat. Microsoft, das seit 2019 über 13 Milliarden Dollar in OpenAI investiert hat, zeigt sich wenig begeistert von diesen Plänen und droht, die Verhandlungen abzubrechen【2-1】【2-5】.

Ein weiterer Streitpunkt ist die Übernahme des AI-Coding-Startups Windsurf durch OpenAI. Microsoft befürchtet, dass Windsurf, das über fortschrittliche Offline-Funktionen verfügt, eine Bedrohung für sein eigenes Produkt GitHub Copilot darstellen könnte. OpenAI hingegen argumentiert, dass die Übernahme von Windsurf nicht unter die bestehenden Vereinbarungen mit Microsoft fällt, was zu weiteren rechtlichen und strategischen Spannungen führt【2-2】【2-8】.

Die Situation wird zusätzlich durch OpenAIs Bestrebungen, neue Investoren wie SoftBank zu gewinnen, verschärft. SoftBank erwägt eine Investition von 30 Milliarden Dollar, was OpenAI auf 300 Milliarden Dollar bewerten würde. Diese Pläne erfordern jedoch eine Reduzierung von Microsofts Eigentumsanteil auf 33%, was in Redmond auf Widerstand stößt【2-7】.

Sollte OpenAI tatsächlich eine Kartellklage gegen Microsoft einreichen, könnte dies nicht nur die Partnerschaft der beiden Unternehmen, sondern auch die gesamte AI-Industrie nachhaltig verändern. Die rechtlichen und regulatorischen Implikationen einer solchen Klage könnten weitreichende Folgen für die zukünftige Entwicklung und Zusammenarbeit im Bereich der Künstlichen Intelligenz haben【2-6】.
